metadata.jobDescription:
Galaxy is looking for an experienced Technical Program Manager (TPM) to join their team.
You will lead a team of global TPMs to achieve business and engineering objectives.

Role partners directly with CTO and Head of Change/Transformation to drive strategic
alignment, execution, and visibility on high-priority projects. Seeking strategic,
highly organized, execution-oriented Senior TPM to lead complex, cross-functional
technology initiatives. Deep experience in agile and traditional project methodologies,
strong technical acumen, excellent stakeholder management.

Key Responsibilities:
- Lead global group of TPMs—sometimes managing initiatives directly, sometimes through them
- Partner with business leaders and technology leads to prioritize diverse initiatives
- Ensure alignment of team and project deliveries with business goals
- Collaborate with global engineering teams across multiple time zones
- Maintain JIRA boards, manage epics, tasks, workflows
- Facilitate team agile ceremonies (stand-ups, grooming, retrospectives, planning)
- Monitor project timelines, milestones, deliverables; proactively identify risks

Requirements:
- 10+ years as Project/Technical Program Manager
- 5+ years managing engineering teams
- Strong technical background with system design understanding
- Executive leadership experience
- JIRA, Confluence, project management tools proficiency
- Cross-functional dependency management
- Agile/Scrum methodology familiarity

Nice to have:
- Crypto or traditional finance exposure
- Regulatory or compliance-driven environment experience

Location: New York, NY
Salary: $225,000 - $275,000 USD

hero.subheadline: Technical Program Manager with 8+ years shipping Web3 infrastructure. From Microsoft's first blockchain project to institutional custody at Anchorage— where Galaxy chose us for staking. I turn cross-functional complexity into shipped products.

about.tagline: Eight years shipping Web3 infrastructure, from dev tools to institutional custody.
bio:
At Anchorage Digital, I lead cross-functional initiatives spanning custody, staking, and protocol integrations. I've shipped 7+ L2 integrations (Optimism, Base, Arbitrum) using a RICE evaluation framework I built, coordinating across 4+ teams and reducing integration time by 40%. Galaxy chose Anchorage for ETH staking specifically because of the institutional-grade infrastructure my team built—zero slashing events, billions in AUM, full key ownership.
I've been in Web3 since 2017, when I shipped one of Microsoft's first blockchain projects—Xbox royalty tracking on Ethereum. Eight years later, I'm still here because {{accent}}this is Web3's moment{{/accent}}—and Galaxy is positioned to define how institutions participate. I understand what it takes to lead global teams through complex, compliance-driven initiatives while maintaining velocity.
